description:
cmd/6c: use full 64-bit address in block copy

Already fixed independently in Plan 9.

messages.text:
*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=ca145611fa96 ***

cmd/6c: use full 64-bit address in block copy

Already fixed independently in Plan 9.

R=ken2
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/10041044

Hello ken2 (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

https://codereview.appspot.com/10041044/diff/5001/src/cmd/6c/cgen.c
File src/cmd/6c/cgen.c (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/10041044/diff/5001/src/cmd/6c/cgen.c#newcode1682
src/cmd/6c/cgen.c:1682: nn->type = types[TIND];
This one was not changed in Plan 9's 6c. Should it have been?

https://codereview.appspot.com/10041044/diff/5001/src/cmd/6c/cgen.c
File src/cmd/6c/cgen.c (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/10041044/diff/5001/src/cmd/6c/cgen.c#newcode1682
src/cmd/6c/cgen.c:1682: nn->type = types[TIND];
On 2013/06/05 23:14:15, ality wrote:
> This one was not changed in Plan 9's 6c. Should it have been?

I think so. Can you report it?

rsc@golang.org once said:
> src/cmd/6c/cgen.c:1682: nn->type = types[TIND];
> On 2013/06/05 23:14:15, ality wrote:
> >This one was not changed in Plan 9's 6c. Should it have been?
> 
> I think so. Can you report it?

Will do. Thanks for the response.

  Anthony
